Body: Can you provide more information about how you're trying to receive the data? You may find this article useful which describes both sending and receiving data to IoT Hub using the Java SDK: https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/iot-hub-java-java-getstarted/
It works! thanks @ Peter Pan and Domic Betts

There are two kinds of messages which include device-to-cloud and cloud-to-device.

For the first kind, device-to-cloud messages, as @DominicBetts said, you can refer to the section Receive device-to-cloud messages to know how to receive d2c messages with Event Hub-compatible endpoint. And there are two samples as references on GitHub
column9:
please see below.

  1. Simple send/receive sample: Shows how to connect then send and receive messages to and from IoT Hub
column10:
passing the protocol of your choices as a parameter.
  • Simple sample handling messages received: : Shows how to connect to IoT Hub and manage messages received from IoT Hub
column11:
passing the protocol of your choices as a parameter.

For the second kind
column13: you can refer to the section Receiving messages on the simulated device to know how to receive c2d messages. The sample code in the article was writen for C#
column14: but I think it's simple for using Java instead of C#
column15:
please notice the note in the section for choosing the suitable protocol.
